frame.name: Success_or_failure
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> has attempted to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>, and the actual outcome of the <fen>Agent</fen>'s action has been resolved, so that it either specifically matches the <fen>Agent</fen>'s intent (e.g. <ment>success</ment>) or does not match it (e.g. <ment>failure</ment>).
<ex><fex name="age">He</fex> <t>pulled</t> <t>off</t> <fex name="goa">his April Fool's Day prank</fex> <fex name="deg">by the barest of margins</fex> .</ex> <ex>Unfortunately, <fex name="age">we</fex> <m>were</m> n't <t>successful</t>. <fex name="goa">DNI</fex></ex> <ex><fex name="age">We</fex> <t>failed</t> <fex name="deg">miserably</fex> <fex name="goa">at getting the gay rights bill passed</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> makes an attempt to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>. <ex><fex name="Agent">John</fex> <t>managed</t> a feeble smile.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to achieve.
<ex>If you don't <t>succeed</t> <fex name="goa">in your subterfuge</fex>, then report back for further orders.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Goal</fen> is achieved (or not).</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which an attempt occurs.
<ex>Your attempt at convincing me has <fex name="deg">utterly</fex> <t>failed</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt succeeds or fails.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Depictive</fen> is a phrase which describes the <fen>Agent</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The place where an attempt succeeds or fails.
<ex><fex name="Place">On the bridge</fex> he <t>succeeded</t> in putting the wig on the corpse.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Role
FE.definition:
<def-root>A participant function in a particular event or in events of a particular kind.
<ex>Benedikt was <t>successful</t> <fex name="rol">as a master brewer of beer</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE is applied to expressions which indicate the prevailing physical conditions for the event, or some concurrent states of affairs.
<ex>And could anybody have <t>succeeded</t> <fex name="Circumstances">under those conditions</fex>, using other methods?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root> The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the success or failure logically follows. This often means that the <fen>Explanation</fen> causes the success or failure, but not in all cases.
<ex> Kerry <t>failed</t> <fex name="exp">because of his inability to tell his own story</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Containing_event
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE denotes an event or state of affairs that occurs or holds at a time that includes the time during which the success or failure reported by the target occurs and of which the success or failure is taken to be a part
<ex>He was <t>successful</t> <fex name="con">in the Smithers v Burns case</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Re_enconding
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Re_encoding</fen> presents the success or failure event as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: succeed.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: achieve an aim or purpose.

lexUnit.name: fail.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be unsuccessful in an undertaking

lexUnit.name: successful.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: accomplishing an aim or purpose.

lexUnit.name: pull off.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: succeed in achieving or winning something difficult.

lexUnit.name: success.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the accomplishment of an aim or purpose.

lexUnit.name: manage.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: succeed in attaining a goal

lexUnit.name: miss.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fail to attend, watch, or participate in.

lexUnit.name: failure.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an endeavor that does not succeed
